00010 #include "Jamoma.h"

00012 enum outlets{
00013         k_outlet_value = 0,
00014         k_outlet_dumpout,
00015         num_outlets
00016 };
00017 
00018 
00022 typedef struct _ramp{
00023         t_object         ob;                                    
00024         void            *obex;                                  
00025         void            *outlets[num_outlets];  
00026         t_symbol        *attr_rampunit;                 
00027         rampunit        *my_ramp;                               
00028 } t_ramp;

00064 void            ramp_int(t_ramp *x, long n);

00067 void            ramp_float(t_ramp *x, double f);

00073 void            ramp_list(t_ramp *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);

00089 /************************************************************************************/
00090 // Class Definition
00091 
00092 int main(void)                          // main receives a copy of the Max function macros table
00093 {
00094         t_class *c;
00095         
00096         jamoma_init();
00097 
00098         // Define our class
00099         c = class_new("jcom.ramp",(method)ramp_new, (method)ramp_free, (short)sizeof(t_ramp), (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00100         class_obexoffset_set(c, calcoffset(t_ramp, obex));
00101         
00102         // Make methods accessible for our class:
00103         class_addmethod(c, (method)ramp_bang,                                   "bang",                                 0);
00104         class_addmethod(c, (method)ramp_int,                                    "int",                                  A_DEFLONG,      0);
00105         class_addmethod(c, (method)ramp_float,                                  "float",                                A_DEFFLOAT,     0);
00106         class_addmethod(c, (method)ramp_list,                                   "list",                                 A_GIMME,        0);
00107         class_addmethod(c, (method)ramp_set,                                    "set",                                  A_GIMME,        0);
00108         class_addmethod(c, (method)ramp_attrset,                                "attrset",                              A_GIMME,        0);
00109         class_addmethod(c, (method)ramp_attrget,                                "attrget",                              A_GIMME,        0);
00110         class_addmethod(c, (method)ramp_setFunction,                    "function",                             A_SYM,          0);
00111         class_addmethod(c, (method)ramp_getFunctionParameter,   "function.parameter.get",       A_GIMME,        0);
00112         class_addmethod(c, (method)ramp_setFunctionParameter,   "function.parameter",   A_GIMME,        0);
00113         class_addmethod(c, (method)ramp_clock,                                  "clock",                                A_SYM,          0);
00114         class_addmethod(c, (method)ramp_assist,                                 "assist",                               A_CANT,         0); 
00115     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_dumpout,                     "dumpout",                              A_CANT,         0);  
00116     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_quickref,            "quickref",                             A_CANT,         0);
00117 
00118         // ATTRIBUTE: rampunit
00119         class_addattr(c, 
00120                 attr_offset_new("drive", _sym_symbol, 0,
00121                 (method)0, (method)ramp_setrampunit, calcoffset(t_ramp, attr_rampunit)));
00122 
00123         // Finalize our class
00124         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00125         ramp_class = c;
00126         
00127         return 0;
00128 }

00131 /************************************************************************************/
00132 // Object Life
00133 
00134 void *ramp_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00135 {
00136         t_ramp  *x = (t_ramp *)object_alloc(ramp_class);
00137         t_atom  a;
00138 
00139         if(x){
00140                 x->outlets[k_outlet_dumpout] = outlet_new(x, 0L);
00141                 x->outlets[k_outlet_value]   = outlet_new(x, 0L);
00142                 object_obex_store((void *)x, _sym_dumpout, (t_object *)x->outlets[k_outlet_dumpout]);
00143 
00144                 x->my_ramp = NULL;
00145                 x->attr_rampunit = _sym_nothing;                
00146                 attr_args_process(x, argc, argv);       // handle attribute args
00147 
00148                 if(x->attr_rampunit == _sym_nothing){
00149                         atom_setsym(&a, gensym("scheduler"));
00150                         object_attr_setvalueof(x, gensym("drive"), 1, &a);
00151                 }
00152         }
00153         return (x);             // return the pointer to our new instantiation
00154 }
00155 
00156 
00157 void ramp_free(t_ramp *x)
00158 {
00159         delete x->my_ramp;
00160         x->my_ramp = NULL;
00161 }

00164 /************************************************************************************/
00165 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00166 
00167 // Method for Assistance Messages
00168 void ramp_assist(t_ramp *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00169 {
00170         if(msg==1)                                              // Inlet
00171                 strcpy(dst, "input");
00172         else{                                                   // Outlets
00173                 switch(arg){
00174                         case k_outlet_value:
00175                                         strcpy(dst, "ramping value");
00176                                         break;
00177                         case k_outlet_dumpout:
00178                                         strcpy(dst, "dumpout");
00179                                         break;
00180                 }
00181         }               
00182 }

00185 void ramp_setFunction(t_ramp *x, t_symbol *functionName)
00186 {
00187         x->my_ramp->setFunction(functionName);
00188 }
00189 
00190 
00191 void ramp_getFunctionParameter(t_ramp *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00192 {
00193         t_symbol        *parameterName;
00194         t_atom          *a;
00195         long            ac = 0;
00196         t_atom          *av = NULL;
00197         
00198         if(!argc){
00199                 error("jcom.ramp: not enough arguments to function.parameter.get");
00200                 return;
00201         }
00202         
00203         parameterName = atom_getsym(argv);
00204         //x->function->getParameter(parameterName, &ac, &av);
00205         x->my_ramp->getFunctionParameter(parameterName, &ac, &av);
00206         if(ac) {
00207                 //atom_setsym(a+0, parameterName);
00208                 //atom_setfloat(a+1, av);
00209                 a = (t_atom *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom)*(ac+1));
00210                 // Forst list item is name of parameter
00211                 atom_setsym(a, parameterName);
00212                 // Next the whole shebang is copied
00213                 sysmem_copyptr(av, a+1, sizeof(t_atom)*ac);
00214                 object_obex_dumpout(x, gensym("function.parameter.get"), ac+1, a);
00215         
00216                 // The pointer to an atom assign in the getParameter method needs to be freed.
00217                 sysmem_freeptr(av);
00218                 sysmem_freeptr(a);
00219         }
00220 }
00221 
00222 
00223 void ramp_setFunctionParameter(t_ramp *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00224 {
00225         //double                value = 0.0;
00226         t_symbol        *parameterName;
00227         
00228         if(argc < 2){
00229                 error("jcom.ramp: not enough arguments to function.parameter");
00230                 return;
00231         }
00232         
00233         parameterName = atom_getsym(argv);
00234         //x->function->setParameter(parameterName, argc-1, argv+1);
00235         x->my_ramp->setFunctionParameter(parameterName, argc-1, argv+1);
00236 }

00239 
00240 // ATTRIBUTE: set rampunit
00241 t_max_err ramp_setrampunit(t_ramp *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00242 {
00243         x->attr_rampunit = atom_getsym(argv);
00244         
00245         if(x->my_ramp)
00246                 delete x->my_ramp;
00247         x->my_ramp = new rampunit(x->attr_rampunit->s_name, ramp_callback, (void *)x);          // create ramp unit
00248         
00249         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00250         #pragma unused(attr)
00251 }
00252 
00253 
00254 void ramp_clock(t_ramp *x, t_symbol *clockName)
00255 {
00256         short   err = 0;
00257         atom    a;
00258         
00259         atom_setsym(&a, clockName);
00260         //x->my_ramp->setclock(clockName);
00261         err = x->my_ramp->attrset(gensym("clock"), 1, &a);
00262 }
00263 
00264 
00265 // Triggered by our Ramp Unit's tick function
00266 void ramp_callback(void *v, short numvalues, double *values)
00267 {       
00268         t_ramp  *x = (t_ramp *)v;
00269         t_atom  *a = (t_atom *)malloc(numvalues * sizeof(t_atom));
00270         short   i;
00271         
00272         for(i=0; i<numvalues; i++)
00273                 atom_setfloat(a+i, values[i]);
00274                 
00275         if(numvalues == 1)
00276                 outlet_float(x->outlets[k_outlet_value], values[0]);
00277         else
00278                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_value], _sym_list, numvalues, a);
00279                 
00280         free(a);
00281 }
00282 
00283 
00284 // BANG -- fire an output -- useful for the async unit
00285 void ramp_bang(t_ramp *x)
00286 {
00287         x->my_ramp->tick();
00288 }

00290 
00291 // INT INPUT
00292 void ramp_int(t_ramp *x, long value)
00293 {
00294         double dval = value;
00295         
00296         x->my_ramp->set(1, &dval);
00297         outlet_float(x->outlets[k_outlet_value], value);
00298 }
00299 
00300 
00301 // FLOAT INPUT
00302 void ramp_float(t_ramp *x, double value)
00303 {
00304         x->my_ramp->set(1, &value);
00305         outlet_float(x->outlets[k_outlet_value], value);
00306 }
00307 
00308 
00309 // SET FLOAT INPUT
00310 void ramp_set(t_ramp *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00311 {
00312         double  *values;
00313         short   i;
00314         
00315         values = (double *)malloc(argc * sizeof(double));
00316 
00317         for(i=0; i<argc; i++)
00318                 values[i] = atom_getfloat(argv+i);
00319 
00320         x->my_ramp->set(argc, values);
00321         free(values);
00322 }
00323 
00324 
00325 // LIST INPUT <value, ramptime>
00326 void ramp_list(t_ramp *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00327 {
00328         short   i;
00329         short   ramp_keyword_index = -1;
00330         double  *values;
00331         
00332         if(argc < 3){
00333                 error("invalid syntax -- not enough args to ramp");
00334                 return;
00335         }
00336 
00337         values = (double *)malloc((argc-2) * sizeof(double));
00338         
00339         for(i=0; i<argc; i++){
00340                 if(argv[i].a_type == A_SYM){
00341                         if(atom_getsym(argv+i) == gensym("ramp")){
00342                                 ramp_keyword_index = i;
00343                                 break;
00344                         }
00345                 }
00346                 values[i] = atom_getfloat(argv+i);
00347         }
00348         
00349         if(argc != (ramp_keyword_index + 2)){
00350                 error("invalid syntax -- missing 'ramp' keyword or wrong args following the 'ramp' keyword");
00351                 return;
00352         }
00353         
00354         x->my_ramp->go(argc-2, values, atom_getfloat(argv+ramp_keyword_index+1));
00355         free(values);
00356 }
00357

00359 // RAMP UNIT ATTRIBUTES
00360 void ramp_attrset(t_ramp *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00361 {
00362         short   err = 0;
00363         
00364         if(argc < 2){
00365                 error("jcom.ramp::attrset -- bad arguments");
00366                 return;
00367         }
00368         err = x->my_ramp->attrset(atom_getsym(argv), argc-1, argv+1);
00369 }
00370 
00371 
00372 void ramp_attrget(t_ramp *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00373 {
00374         short   err = 0;
00375         
00376         t_symbol        *parameterName;
00377         t_atom          *a;
00378         long    ac = 0;
00379         t_atom  *av = NULL;
00380         
00381         if(argc != 1){
00382                 error("jcom.ramp::attrset -- bad arguments");
00383                 return;
00384         }
00385 
00386         parameterName = atom_getsym(argv);      
00387         err = x->my_ramp->attrget(parameterName, ac, av);
00388         if(!err && ac) {
00389                 // Assign memory so that attr values can be copied
00390                 a = (t_atom *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom)*(ac+1));
00391                 // First list item is name of parameter
00392                 atom_setsym(a, parameterName);
00393                 // Next the whole shebang is copied
00394                 sysmem_copyptr(a+1, av, sizeof(t_atom)*ac);
00395                 object_obex_dumpout(x, gensym("current.parameter"), ac+1, a);
00396         
00397                 // The pointer to an atom assign in the getParameter method needs to be freed.
00398                 sysmem_freeptr(av);
00399                 sysmem_freeptr(a);
00400         }
00401 }
